intro: Verbena diffusa, commonly known as common verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of blue, purple, and white, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders and containers. Verbena diffusa is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
